moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5: Sicilian-Rossolimo Variation. I had just learned the opening.
moves.3... d6 4. d4 cxd4 5. Nxd4 Bd7 6. Bxc6 B: Here I was deciding that when it got to the endgame, if I wanted to have two Knight and he have two Bishops.
moves.10... Bxf6 11. O-O O-O 12. Re1 Re8 13. N: He is starting to attacking my king.
moves.15. Qf3: So I started protecting my king.
moves.15... Rac8: He moved there to attack my c2 pawn and put more pressure on the f2 pawn.
moves.16. Re2 Qd8 17. c3: I don't know why I didn't do that before on move 16. But I needed my rook for other purposes.
moves.19. Nd2: !! I think this is an excellent move. The Knight is attacking the Rook and protecting the e4 square. Just where I wanted my Knight to be.
moves.19... Rcc8 20. Qg4 Rcd8 21. f4: He cannot take the f4 pawn because of me taking his Queen.
moves.21... Qd7 22. Qxd7 Rxd7 23. g4: I am attacking the center now.
moves.23... Bh4 24. Rf1 Rde7: Now Black can take on f4 pawn.
moves.25... Bg5 26. Nf3 Bf6: ?? I don't know why he did that. He should of had gone to f4.
moves.33. Rb6: I wanted to munch up his pawns.
